comment: It's no reason how much love and respect I have for a teacher I never met in person. Although I ended up switching my major, Professor Yarbrough made BLAW a breeze compared to other hardcore professors in this field. It still had its challenges, but it was organized, gave us ample amount of time to complete assignments and is pretty communicative.

I recommend taking him for BLAW. There were a few quizzes and three exams. They're all online no lockdown and webcam. I had him at night but we always ended class very early. Very easy A. The professor made business law easy and less stressful. TAKE HIM

Attendance was mandatory, but classes only lasted for about 30 minutes. He canceled class a couple of times throughout the semester. All tests are online, not proctored. Would recommend if you want an easy A!

TAKE HIM! All his tests and quizzes are open notes and online the literal only downside to him is that attendance is mandatory but you don't really have to pay attention. It's clear that he has a passion for what he does and wants to share it with students. If you are okay with a later class and don't mind the mandatory attendance then take him.
The tests were kind of hard, but we only had 4. Most of the graded assignments are discussions and smartbooks from connect. Those are pretty easy, and the class is straightforward.

TAKE HIM! Fairly easy and interesting course. Quiz and tests are online. Also attendance isnt mandatory but i would 100% suggest you show up cause he gives extra credit to the people who do. He also let us out of class early a lot. you don't NEED textbook but its useful. Loved this class lecture was boring sometimes but prof was great.

Take him! Easy A for sure. The class is actually pretty interesting. Everything is online and open note (tests and quizzes).  Attendance is not required although he takes attendance because he will only use it to your advantage at the end of the year!

10 quizzes with no specific due dates open until last day of classes, 3 tests total. Quizzes had 5 questions with 10 minute limit. Exams opened for a full 24 hours. All quizzes and tests were open notes. Attendance optional. All content was in powerpoints used during lecture, occasional pop quiz for extra credit in class. Super nice guy overall!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes--Amazing lectures

comment: He grades you based off of 10 chapter quizzes which are easy & 3 test. If you do poorly on a test, he offers extra credit to go towards your lowest test grade. You also receive extra credit for showing up to class. The quizzes are similar to the test. Go to class, complete the quizzes, and try on the test & you'll be perfectly fine!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He is a great professor and available to help you if you need it. you are graded only on a few open note quizzes and 3 exams and he gives extra credit assignment at the end of the semester. He gives good lectures, good examples, and curves test grade if there's a low average. You definitely need to study the material before taking the exam though.

This class was pretty good. He's a very nice guy and is respectable. TBH i skipped this class maybe 2-3 times a month but I'm still doing okay on grades. 2 tests with a cheat sheet that really helps out. find our old quizlets and copy and paste every single term on the paper. there are weekly quizzes that are easy to find info online.

Easy class if you try. I found the reason most of my classmates were not passing is because they didn't study until the night before. Study quizlets and you should be fine. Tests are curved which cause you to get an A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Yarbrough is a nice guy and his class is pretty easy. He lectures right off the powerpoint for the entire class. BUY THE BOOK. The tests are hard but he curves and there is a weekly quiz that is worth 20 points. Quizzes are easy and get you through. Read the book and the powerpoints and you'll be fine. Occasionally offers extra credit.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Read the book and show up for class. Tests are hard but he curves. Gives quizzes in D2L. Those are easy and get you through.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Caring

comment: USE YOUR TEXTBOOK!!! I found class to be boring as he just went over Powerpoints that he posts on D2l anyway. And test Q come from the textbook readings. The only saving grace is that he curves tests and offers extra credit assignments.

Attendance is not mandatory, but it can help your final grade in the end. The tests are hard, but there is extra credit and online quizzes that balance that out. Make sure you keep up with the quizzes. Does offer extra credit/pop quizzes. Have to show up for those or you miss out. If you read the book and come to class, you will be fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY
